intro: Hieracium jaliscense var. ghiesbreghtii, commonly known as the Jalisco hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its yellow flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and disturbed soils, showcasing a compact growth habit. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are arranged in a flat-topped cluster. This variety is notable for its limited distribution and is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological and genetic traits.
